DataElement.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-TC26 Past Week Concerned about Disruption of Family Life Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of the extent to which they have been concerned about disruption of their family life during the past week, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-TC26 Past Week Concerned about Disruption of Family Life Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London._A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 26 questions designed to assess quality of life in testicular cancer patients._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual is or was concerned about disruption of family life._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire - Testicular Cancer 26
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.:A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 26 questions designed to assess quality of life in testicular cancer patients.

Concepts.longName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.

Concepts.longName: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Testicular Cancer 26
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 26 questions designed to assess quality of life in testicular cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Concerned about Disruption of Family Life Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual is or was concerned about disruption of family life.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Concerned about Disruption of Family Life
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual is or was concerned about disruption of family life.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
